CatalogManagerLayout().docstring: CatalogManagerLayout wraps catalog manager portal pages.

SupportStaffLayout({ ... }).docstring: SupportStaffLayout wraps support staff portal pages.

AuthProvider({ ... }).docstring:
AuthProvider wraps parts of the app that require authentication state.
It manages authentication state including access and refresh tokens,
and exposes actions to login, logout, and refresh tokens.

useAuthContext().docstring:
useAuthContext is a custom hook to access authentication state and actions.
@throws Error if used outside AuthProvider.

LayoutProvider({ ... }).docstring: LayoutProvider wraps parts of the app that need layout state (e.g. sidebar open/close).

useLayout().docstring:
Custom hook to use the layout context.
@throws Error if used outside LayoutProvider.

CatalogForgotPasswordForm().docstring:
CatalogForgotPasswordForm allows Catalog Managers
to request password reset by providing their username.

CatalogLoginForm().docstring:
CatalogLoginForm is a login form for Catalog Managers.
It uses react-hook-form for validation and axiosClient to call
POST /api/auth/login/catalog-manager/.

Dashboard().docstring: Dashboard is a placeholder component displaying basic authentication info.

LoginForm().docstring:
LoginForm demonstrates the usage of React Hook Form with Chakra UI atoms.
It replaces the previous Tailwind-based implementation.

updateInventoryRow(payload).docstring:
updateInventoryRow(payload: InventoryUpdatePayload):
Performs the POST to /api/cm/inventory
Returns a promise that resolves if successful, rejects if error

parseInventoryCsv(file).docstring:
parseInventoryCsv(file: File):
- Reads and parses the CSV.
- Ensures required columns (sku, source_code, quantity) are present.
- Any row with invalid numeric 'quantity' triggers parse failure.
- If valid, returns rows with status="Pending".

getCsrfToken().docstring:
csrf.ts provides a basic setup for CSRF protection.
This file can be extended to include specific configurations if required by the backend.

Modal({ ... }).docstring:
Modal component that displays content in an overlay using Chakra UI. @example setModalOpen(false)}>
Modal Content

OptimizedImage({ ... }).docstring:
OptimizedImage
A wrapper over Chakra UI's Image that sets loading="lazy" to defer off-screen image loading.
This component can be used throughout the application to ensure optimized image delivery.
@param {ImageProps} props - Props passed to the Chakra Image component.

Footer().docstring: Footer component, displayed at the bottom of the application.

Header().docstring:
Header component for the application.
Provides a hamburger button to toggle the sidebar and displays the portal title.

MainContent({ ... }).docstring: MainContent component encapsulates the primary content area.

useSession().docstring:
useSession hook monitors the current session token.
It can be extended for token expiry or idle timeout management.
